summary: A Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) filed by FirstBank Puerto Rico with FinCEN regarding suspicious financial transactions totaling $1,740,000 involving Jeffrey Epstein and his associated entities (Laurel Inc, F T Real Estate Inc, etc.) from June 2018 to March 2019. The report was triggered by negative news linking account signers to sex offenses and details wire transfers with no apparent business purpose. This document is a Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) filed by a financial institution under the Bank Secrecy Act. It details unusual wire transfers and transactions totaling $1,740,000.00 linked to Jeffrey Epstein and HBRK Associates Inc. into specific customer accounts, occurring between June 25, 2018 and March 29, 2019. The bank flagged the activity as suspicious due to an inability to validate the purpose of the large incoming funds.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Identified as the primary individual subject of the suspicious activity report, with his personal details, identification, and address listed. The narrative links him to entities under review and cites negative news articles about him.

persons.name: David J. Mitchell
persons.context: Identified as the originator of two incoming wire transfers totaling $840,000 to a commercial checking account associated with the case. The narrative provides background on his corporate roles.

persons.context: Named as a payee on a check processed from a commercial checking account linked to the investigation.

locations: FirstBank Plaza (721), East End Plaza (717), Waterfront (719) branches (USVI)
521 Harbor City Boulevard Melbourne, Florida, USA
keyFacts: A SAR was filed reporting $1,740,000 in suspicious financial activity involving Jeffrey Epstein and his network from June 2018 to March 2019.
The bank's investigation was triggered by negative news articles identifying account signers as sex offenders.
Specific suspicious wire transfers of $225,000 (Oct 2017) and $180,000 (Sept 2018) lacked any apparent business purpose or service rendered.
Epstein-associated entities listed include Laurel Inc, F T Real Estate Inc, Michelles Transportation Company LLC, and the Jeffrey Epstein VI Foundation.
Large transactions were noted, including an $840,000 wire transfer from David J. Mitchell and a $50,000 check to the National Crime Victim Bar Association.
A $200,000.00 incoming wire transfer was originated by Jeffrey Epstein care of HBRK Associates Inc. into a monitored account.
Three additional incoming wire transfers totaling $320,000.00 were issued by HBRK ASSOCIATES, INC. into a commercial checking account, with no stated purpose.
The financial institution filed a Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) for $1,740,000.00, citing the period from June 25, 2018, to March 29, 2019.
The bank's investigation found no relevant public information to validate the purpose or line of business of the issuer (HBRK Associates Inc.) of the funds.

Other transactions noted include numerous checks payable to Virgin Islands authorities (Port Authority, Water and Power Authority, Government) and companies like Reefco Services Inc. and TRI Island Energy LLC.
